title: Intermediate English 302
headline: Master computer vocabulary and comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs in this free online English course.
description: This English course introduces you to basic computer vocabulary to help you identify different parts and functions so you sound proficient. You will also learn how to form 'adverbs of manner' from adjectives and understand what makes an adverb different from an adjective. You will review comparative and superlative adjectives and understand how to form comparative and superlative adverbs. Start this course and begin learning today!
courseDescription:
Computers form a key part of our everyday lives. We use computers for work, entertainment, personal projects, and learning. You are probably on a computer right now thinking about taking this course. This course is designed to teach you the English words needed to name computer parts and functions you encounter daily. We understand that learning English is important to you, so Alison has put together a set of courses to help you achieve your language goals.

After learning about computer parts and standard computer functions, you will encounter two grammar topics. The first section will focus on 'adverbs of manner.' These adverbs modify verbs or describe the 'how' of a verb. Understand how these adverbs are formed and where to place them in a sentence. For example, did you know that words such as 'fast' and 'late' can be adjectives and adverbs? Learn how to identify when these words are adjectives and when they are adverbs. The second grammar lesson will focus on comparatives and superlatives. You will review adjectives, learn to make comparisons between objects that are alike, and then master forming comparative and superlative adverbs.

The course's final section helps you practice your new grammar skills. There are exercises in reading, listening, speaking, and writing to improve your skills using what you have discovered about computer parts, computer functions, 'adverbs of manner,' comparative and superlative adjectives, and comparative and superlative adverbs. Let Alison's courses help you become fluent in everyday conversations about computers and technology. Know how to identify computer parts when talking to a computer technician about your technical problems and how to discuss basic computer functions. Let our English courses help you become a proficient English speaker.
